Spoofy:

I only use "Nero" to burn my films and as for re encoding them, I don't use dvd shrink. I use a program called Avi2DVD.. I'm not sure if you're aware of it, but it does take a lot of playing around with this program and takes while to complete a whole film but the result is amazing.. DVDR to perfection..

i use 2 programmes mainly

dvd shrink (wherever possible i try to reauthor so as to get the maximum size for the film) or

dvd fab express which handles those lovely sony discs

i used to use dvd decrypter but sadly that is no more

yes you are quite right though, i do not know how long it takes with the programme you use only how long it takes with the programmes i use which with a 3.4 P4 takes between 17-35 mins

Avi2Dvd works in both Avi mode and Dvd mode, where you choose your own audio stream, subtitles and build your own menus.. Converts all of these and makes a dvd version for you. Just trying to get to know the program takes some time, but it's worht it in the long run.
Think - you take an avi film which is about 700mbs, adjust the audio and video, add your subtitles, then create your own menu. What do you have? Look at what I put out!
It takes a lot of work and patients.

Smurf, eller vad är det man brukar säga? :P
fan vad bra en stor tack

If i get the error when burning with Nero and cant use DVD Shrink to re-author it, I use Nero Vision Express and select create DVD, i then drag the movie files from the downloaded fils (these will be the highest is size). I then create the DVD to my hard drive. When this has finished you can open DVD shrink and point it to the movies you just created with Nero Vision and will open the whole movie.

Sorry for the long draw out process, I am no expert on this but is the only way i have found it to work.

On the other hand you can always just ignore the error that nero gives, It usually works for me.

Later Guys, Thanks for the download.
